definition: lit. not to shed a tear until one sees the coffin (idiom)/fig. refuse to be convinced until one is faced with grim reality
pinyin: bu4 jian4 guan1 cai5 bu4 luo4 lei4

definition: geezer with one foot in the grave (used jokingly or as an imprecation)

sentences.english: The body was placed in bier before burial.
sentences.chinese: 在举行葬礼以前尸体被放在棺材里。

sentences.english: After this, the coffin burger is ready to eat.
sentences.chinese: 之后，“棺材板”就可以吃了。

sentences.english: In a sign of the times, one carpentry shop now sells ready-made coffins.
sentences.chinese: 随着时代改变，有一家木材店现在也买现成的棺材。

sentences.english: Today, caskets are usually placed in above-ground-vaults, like the ones pictured here.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如图所示，棺材通常都放置在地上灵堂。

sentences.english: It's not that easy, buddy, not when people's lifestyles are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 没那么容易的，伙计，人类都是不见棺材不掉泪的。

sentences.english: How many moderns greatly live a person to return Dou however this how many ancient times of rock coffin?
sentences.chinese: 几个现代的大活人还斗不过这几个古代的石头棺材吗？

sentences.english: Without embarrassment, I covered his coffin with the largest, reddest roses I could find.
sentences.chinese: 没有窘迫，我用很多鲜艳的红玫瑰铺在棺材上。

sentences.english: The contraband was reported to be hidden in wooden boxes shaped like coffins.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，这些走私品被藏在形状像棺材的木箱里。

sentences.english: And he flung a shovelful of earth on the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 同时他铲起一锹土，摔在棺材上。

sentences.english: They say the can bears a casket, and that black-robed monks walk behind it.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，车里有一个棺材，黑袍的神父们走在后面。

sentences.english: She went to the coffin, very soft, and kneeled down and looked in.
sentences.chinese: 她轻轻地来到棺材前面，跪下去往里看了一看。

sentences.english: Then each Little Man put one white flower on the box, and they went away.
sentences.chinese: 接着每个小矮人在棺材上放了一朵白花，然后离开了。

sentences.english: Louis: Okay. I'm game. I'll try some coffin bread.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我有兴趣，我会试试棺材板。

sentences.english: There you are, in the coffin, or in an urn, your body reduced to a husk of meant-to-be’s.
sentences.chinese: 你现在是这副样子，躺在棺材里，或者骨灰盒里。

sentences.english: Old building is very large, and is surrounded by a coffin, top-down lined up.
sentences.chinese: 古楼里十分大，且四周都是棺材，由上至下整齐排列。

definition: to put dead body in coffin
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)
buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)
bier/bed kept as it was when the deceased was alive
